Caption:
SILENCE

Pause, Reflection, Stillness, Transcendence

In the midst of daily stress, future anxiety, and the fear of the unknown, our minds race, creating inner turmoil that reflects in our external world.

However, amidst this chaos, there is a sanctuary: Silence.

When we slow down our minds, go inward, and dive deeper, we trust in the power of the pause. Silence is more than just putting your phone on airplane mode; it presents a landscape of unburdened possibilities. The most blissful state offers the space to create the reality we want to see.

In silence, we find:
Clarity - Space to think without distraction, to understand our true desires and intentions.
Healing - A retreat from the constant noise that wears down our mental and emotional well-being.
Connection - A deeper bond with our inner self, fostering intuition and inner wisdom.

Silence can promote neuroplasticityâ€”the brainâ€™s ability to reorganize itself by forming new neural connections. This means that in silence, our brains have the opportunity to heal, grow, and develop new pathways that enhance our cognitive functions and emotional resilience.

Many great artists, writers, and thinkers throughout history have attributed their most profound insights and creative breakthroughs to moments of deep silence. In these quiet moments, the mind is free to wander and explore new ideas, leading to innovative solutions and artistic inspiration.

Take time each day to embrace a moment of silence, as challenging as it might be. Find a quiet spot, close your eyes, and breathe deeply. Allow yourself to be still. Listen to the whispers of your soul. In this sacred silence, we discover our true selves and the profound tranquillity that lies within.

Remember, silence is not empty; it is full of answers; it is full of healing.ğŸŒ¿âœ¨

#Mindfulness #HolisticWellness #InnerPeace #EnergyHealing #SelfCare #Silence #Reflection #Stillness #Transcendence

Caption:
âœ¨ï¸ Cultivating Self-Compassion: A Path to Inner Peace âœ¨ï¸

Self-compassion is the practice of extending kindness to oneself, especially during difficult times. 

It involves treating yourself with the same gentleness and understanding that you would offer to a friend. 

To cultivate self-compassion, start by practising positive self-talk and challenging self-critical thoughts. 

Writing a letter to yourself expressing love and encouragement can also be a powerful exercise. 

Affirm your worth by reminding yourself, "I am deserving of love and compassion." Or anything suit you. 

Finally, create a self-care routine that prioritizes your well-being. 

By nurturing yourself with kindness, you will foster a sense of inner peace and resilience, and your inner child will be so grateful to you â¤ï¸.

Caption:
People often see you when youâ€™re on the brink of success, but the real story lies in the struggle that got you there. Itâ€™s easy for others to recognize your achievements and celebrate your victories, but the countless hours of hard work, the moments of doubt, and the persistent efforts behind the scenes often go unnoticed. 

In the quiet hours, when youâ€™re working late into the night or pushing through exhaustion, thatâ€™s where your true character is forged. These are the moments that define who you are. Itâ€™s the consistent effort, the determination to keep going despite obstacles, and the resilience to rise after every fall that truly shape your path. 

Success is not a sudden event; it is a culmination of small, often unnoticed efforts that compound over time. Every step forward, no matter how small, is progress. Every challenge faced and overcome adds to your strength. The journey may be long and filled with hurdles, but itâ€™s these very struggles that make your success meaningful. 

Focus on your journey. Embrace the process with all its highs and lows. Understand that every effort you put in is a building block towards your future. Itâ€™s not just about the end goal, but about who you become along the way. Your efforts define you far more than the accolades you receive. 

So, keep pushing forward. Stay dedicated to your path, and let your hard work speak for itself. Remember, when you finally reach your success, youâ€™ll look back and realize that the struggle was the most beautiful part of your story. Your journey, with all its challenges and triumphs, is what makes your success truly yours

Caption:
WINNING ğŸ¥‡!
Every single day I try and get a â€œWINâ€.
How I measure my â€œWâ€™sâ€ may sound a little easy, but when you start stacking them â€œWâ€™sâ€ every day, every week, every month, compounding into yearâ€™s it will
change your whole life. â€œTrust meâ€ 
Although I do not win every single day, I try my hardest to keep stacking them up ğŸ’¯.
-
Using this formula has got me to where I am today. Every single day I create a â€œPOWERâ€ list and execute it! The list could be handwritten or digitally stored. My power list contains five essential items I must complete daily, and anything else I get done is a bonus. Completing this POWER list daily = a W. If I do not complete the items on the POWER list, there is no W.
E.g. 
-
POWER
* Post
* Finish onboarding call
* Work on speech
* Client call
* Partner call
-
I have been doing this for years now, and it has helped me to stay on track. Staying accountable to get that W every day stops me from slipping.
-
I regularly compare what my life looked like five years ago to now. I did not care about a W. My life consisted of gangs, drugs, alcohol, self-sabotage, crime, and bad mental health, none of which will get me a â€œWâ€.
-
IT ALL STARTS WITH YOUR DAILY ACTIONS. 
-
You will not catch me SLIPPING any more. Who else is STACKING them Wâ€™s? ğŸ‘‘ğŸ”¥ğŸ˜

Um tio-avÃ´, que o meu pai adorava e, inevitavelmente, lembrei-me dele, uma vez mais, e de tudo aquilo que nÃ£o fizemos. Tudo aquilo que fomos adiando. 
Numa conversa com a minha querida psicologa.anacorreia, partilhava que o luto estÃ¡ a trazer-me um sentido de urgÃªncia: quero viver tudo hoje e agora. NÃ£o quero adiar mais nada. Mas a vida nÃ£o Ã© sempre assim. E jÃ¡ passamos os dias a correr, portantoâ€¦ para quÃª correr mais? Correr para onde? Para quÃª? Talvez o segredo esteja mesmo em parar. Saber parar. E, no meio destes sentimentos contraditÃ³rios, deparei-me com um texto - muito certeiro - que recebi no meu e-mail. 
Bronnie Ware Ã© uma escritora, cantora e compositora australiana. Durante anos, trabalhou como enfermeira nos cuidados paliativos e foi partilhando num blog as histÃ³rias dos pacientes que estavam Ã  beira da morte. Ao acompanhar essas pessoas que sabiam que iam morrer, percebeu que, nesses Ãºltimos momentos, elas ganhavam uma enorme consciÃªncia sobre o que tinham sido as suas vidas. Foi assim que escreveu o livro â€œAntes de partirâ€ (â€œThe top 5 regrets of the dyingâ€) onde aborda os 5 maiores arrependimentos das pessoas Ã  beira da morte:

1) Gostava de ter tido a coragem de viver a vida como eu queria e nÃ£o da forma como os outros esperavam
2) Gostava de nÃ£o ter trabalhado tanto 
3) Gostava de ter tido a coragem de expressar os meus sentimentos 
4) Gostava de ter mantido o contacto com os meus amigos 
5) Gostava de me ter permitido ser mais feliz 

Eu identifico-me com, pelo menos, dois destes arrependimentos. E vocÃªs? 

(inspirado numa newsletter do Karl Moore da Inspire 3 @awesomestation )

Caption:
ğŸ§ Our minds are extraordinary storytellers, weaving narratives that shape our perceptions and influence the very essence of our emotions. 

âœ¨The stories we tell ourselves can either lift us up or weigh us down. But with emotional intelligence and cognitive behavioral techniques, we have the power to âœï¸rewrite these narratives to reflect our true potential.

ğŸ¤Let me share a personal journey. Right now, Iâ€™m in the midst of changing my narrative so deeply that I believe my very cells are transforming. I talk to my body and spirit daily, using different methods to signal that a new story is beginning. This new chapter is one of health, joy, and vibrant fashion.ğŸ‘—

Emotional intelligence has taught me to recognize and manage my emotions, allowing me to view my stories from a fresh perspectiveâœ¨. It has shown me how to challenge the validity of my negative self-talk and replace it with new words, new messages, and a new perspective. 

In my book, â€œFind Your Voice,â€ I explore how cognitive behavior can reshape our inner dialogue. Give your inner voice a name, mine is Fearful Fran! This will help you detach from fixed messages.

Here are a few tips to help you get started:

AWARENESS: Begin by identifying the negative stories you tell yourself. Write them down and acknowledge their presence.

CHALLENGE: Question the truth of these stories. Are they based on facts or mere assumptions?

REWRITE: Replace negative narratives with positive affirmations. Focus on your strengths and past successes.

PRACTICE: Consistently practice these new narratives. Over time, they will become your new reality.

YOU have the power to change your story. It starts with a single step towards self-awareness and a commitment to positive change. Just as I am transforming my own narrative, you too can start a new chapter full of health, fun, and a sense of style that truly represents who you are.

Caption:
Happiness isn't something you find, it's something you create. Cultivate joy in every moment.

Embrace the simple pleasures, surround yourself with positivity, and radiate love and kindness.

Let go of what you can't control and focus on what you can, your attitude and your actions. Remember, a happy life is not about having everything you want, but about appreciating everything you have.

Cultivate joy daily, and watch how it transforms your world.

Caption:
Have you ever felt overwhelmed by your emotions or struggled to make sense of your thoughts?  Here are the top signs itâ€™s time to start journaling:

	1.	Emotional Overwhelm: If you often feel like your emotions are all over the place, itâ€™s a top most sign that you need a healing journal as it can help you process and understand them.
	2.	Frequent Stress: Writing down your worries and stressors can provide relief and perspective.
	3.	Trouble Sleeping: A cluttered mind can affect your sleep. Journaling before bed can help clear your mind and improve your sleep quality.
	4.	Lack of Clarity: If you find it hard to make decisions or understand your feelings, journaling can provide insight and clarity.
	5.	Desire for Growth: Journaling is a powerful tool for personal growth and self-discovery.

Caption:
Challenge Your Beliefs
Take a belief youâ€™ve held for a long time and pretend you believe in the exact opposite for a few minutes. 

Notice how you feel when you do this. 

The belief you choose can be related to religion, politics, education, gender, medicine, or just life in general. 

The stronger your belief, the more effective this exercise will be.

For example, you believe in God. Pretend you are an Atheist.

Or you are pro-Brexit - noW pretend you are anti-Brexit.

How does it make you feel to fight the other corner? 

There are no right or wrong answers here, we simply want to try and understand where the people on the other side of these beliefs are coming from. 

You can learn a lot about yourself and peaple around you from this simple exercise.

Caption:
Nel giorno del compleanno di Rapunzel, i genitori accendono le lanterne e le lanciano nel cielo, insieme a tutto il regno, affinchÃ© la loro bambina rapita ritrovi la strada ..
Rapunzel, intanto, rinchiusa, a sua insaputa, da una strega vanitosa, in una torre, ammira questo miracolo luminoso che, â€˜chissÃ  come maiâ€™, accade sempre il giorno del suo compleanno.. Una bellissima immagine per ricordarci di seguire le lanterne per ribellarci e tornare alla nostra rinascita .. rapunzel ama e proprio grazie a quellâ€™amore che rinasce.. il ritorno al bello, alla luce di se stessi.. le vere rinascite appartengono, sempre, al mondo dellâ€™amore .

Caption:
"Embrace daily gratitude by writing down things you're thankful for, verbally expressing appreciation, and focusing on positive experiences.
This habit enhances emotional well-being, fosters positivity, and strengthens relationships."

Embracing daily gratitude is a transformative practice that can enrich your life in countless ways. Start by writing down things you're thankful for each day, whether it's a beautiful sunrise, a kind gesture from a friend, or a moment of peace and quiet. 

Verbally express your appreciation to those around you, whether it's a simple thank you to a colleague or a heartfelt expression of gratitude to a loved one. 

By focusing on positive experiences and moments of gratitude, you cultivate a mindset of abundance and contentment. This habit not only enhances your emotional well-being but also fosters positivity in your daily life.

Caption:
Self-betrayal is an unconscious, automatic trauma response to childhood abandonment and neglect. Healing from it requires self-compassion and self-forgiveness work as your parentsâ€™ conditional love for you wasnâ€™t your fault. It was a byproduct of their own unhealed childhood emotional wounding and the resulting psychological immaturity and lack of self-awareness
.

This dynamic often shows up in adult relationships as pursuing â€œunavailableâ€ people, pursuing people who are uninterested in you, pursuing people who are bad for you, being stuck in cycles of unrequited love, or trying to â€œfixâ€ your partners
.

Abandoning yourself will not keep others from abandoning you. Betraying yourself wonâ€™t â€œmakeâ€ people love you. Denying your true needs doesnâ€™t â€œcreate attractionâ€. You need to wake up to your New Truth that, as an adult, now you have the power and awareness to CHOOSE YOURSELF. This looks like practicing self-compassion and focusing on building safe, predictable, nurturing relationships with people who truly care about you
.

Join us on Patreon for more of my teachings and to become a part of our self-reparenting community. Link in bio (patreon.com/acceptandact)
.

Caption:
*Slip Casting*
.
A little insight into the process involved and what you can achieve on one of my slip casting workshops ğŸ¥°
.
Itâ€™s a really therapeutic and enjoyable process where you will work with porcelain, use a selection of tools and be shown different hand decorating techniques to bring your very own slip casted pieces to life. 
.
On this workshop you will be able to slip cast 3 pieces in porcelain in the morning which include a small tealight holder, plant pot and stem vase. After a lunch break you will then spend a relaxing afternoon decorating your pieces using porcelain decorating slips and a variety of different tools. I demonstrate lots of techniques that you can try out and will get to practice these onto clay tiles before you start on your pieces. 
.
Not only will you learn new skills on this workshop but you will come away with your very own beautiful collection of pottery that you can keep for yourself and put in pride of place at home or give as a lovely and thoughtful gift.
.
All of your pieces will be fired after the workshop. 
.
Workshop group sizes are a maximum of 5 people so lots of 1 to 1 support is available. 
.
Fancy having a go? Visit www.alexallday.co.uk to book your place today or send me a message for more info. 
.
Upcoming dates:
- Saturday 15th June 
- Saturday 20th July 
- Saturday 17th August 

Canâ€™t make any dates advertised but would like to do the workshop? Then donâ€™t hesitate to get in touch and we can arrange for you or a small group to come on a date that suits ğŸ˜Š
.
All of my workshops take place in my studio at Middleport Pottery, ST6 3PE

Caption:
Starting the day with a positive mindset can set the tone for everything that follows. Here are a few tips to kickstart your morning and keep that positive energy flowing all day long:

*Gratitude First: Take a moment to reflect on what you're grateful for. It could be as simple as the sunshine or a cozy bed.
*Move Your Body: A bit of morning exercise can do wonders. Whether itâ€™s a brisk walk, yoga, or a quick workout, get your blood pumping.
*Healthy Breakfast: Fuel your body with a nutritious breakfast. Think fruits, whole grains, and a good source of protein.
*Mindfulness: Spend a few minutes meditating or simply breathing deeply to center yourself.
*Set Intentions: Outline your goals for the day. Keeping a clear focus helps maintain a positive outlook.
*Positive Affirmations: Speak kind words to yourself. Youâ€™ve got this!

Remember, a positive mind attracts positive vibes. Letâ€™s make today amazing! ğŸŒŸ

Caption:

Thoughts have to be convincing to stay relevant in your life because if they arenâ€™t, then youâ€™ll learn the truth about themâ€¦

Theyâ€™re just waves of energy coming in and out of your awarenessâ€¦all day longâ€¦

Once you realize this, you become less attached to your thoughts and let them come and go.

You begin to realize that you are not your thoughts.

You begin to realize that you are the one with the power to decide what you will believe and what you wonâ€™t.

 Sabato 15 giugno ore 8.30

Il rituale della gratitudine, ci riporta con i piedi per terra e ci rende consapevoli di quanta abbondanza ci sia nelle nostre vite. 

Sperimentando la gratitudine ogni giorno, mandiamo un messaggio chiaro alla vita ed essa ci dona esperienze positive, salute, possibilitÃ  e tanto altro. 

Immerso nella riserva naturale del parco faunistico della riserva di Bellocchio, (Lido di Spina), tra lago e mare un passo dopo lâ€™altro per esprimere gratitudine, fino ad arrivare direttamente a riva, dove immergerai i piedi nellâ€™acqua e beneficerai della sua forza, della sua potenza, della sua purezza  per coglierne la sua totale energia. Al rientro un messaggio allâ€™universo, alla vita per le tue buone intenzioni. 

Un momento esclusivamente DEDICATO SOLO A TE.

To be more productive, set clear and specific goals, prioritize tasks, and create a structured schedule. Minimize distractions by creating a dedicated workspace and using time management techniques like the Pomodoro Technique and time blocking. Leverage productivity tools and automate repetitive tasks. Focus on single-tasking, stay organized, and regularly review and reflect on your progress to continually improve your productivity.

Caption:
I once heard that the definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over while expecting a different result. This idea got me thinking about our â€˜thoughts.â€™ Youâ€™ve probably heard of the term â€˜monkey mindâ€™â€”those thoughts that pop into your head and spiral into endless scenarios. Hereâ€™s the antidote: donâ€™t try to stop the momentum of negative thought patterns. Instead, focus on building positive momentum.
Start small. Notice whatâ€™s going right in your lifeâ€”your relationships, career, travels, or anything else you find satisfying. Itâ€™s empowering! The teachings of Abraham Hicks suggest, â€œLet the positive momentum become who you are.â€
Take charge of your thoughts and create the life you want! ğŸŒŸ

Caption: Your home is where your thought ( & yoga  mat is)

Happy Monday! What better way to start the week than a provider shoutout? Today we are highlighting Krissy Zechmann, LICSW. 

For the past 17 years, Krissy has enjoyed working with individuals and families in a variety of social work and mental health settings. Her previous experience includes outpatient mental health therapy, child welfare services, hospice social work, and most recently, school based mental health serving within Millard Public Schools District.

Krissy has expertise in assisting individuals and families in management of symptoms related to anxiety, depression, mood disorders, behavioral issues, environmental stressors, and major life changes. She enjoys working with adolescents and adults while providing individualized treatment to all patients.
â€‹
Further, she brings a wealth of knowledge and experience working with people who are faced with difficult end of life related issues.  She understands grief and loss and is passionate about walking with those who are terminally ill and those who have a loved one who is nearing the end stages of life. Krissy knows that loss comes in many forms over a lifetime and encourages those who are struggling to seek support.

Krissy understands that the development of trust and rapport is crucial in the therapy process. She believes that everyone deserves dignity and respect and she strives to provide that to every person she works with. Her goal in therapy is guide those in the healing process while teaching effective ways to manage symptoms, stressors, and conflicts in life. 

Krissy is currently accepting new patients. Give us a call today to learn more! (402) 614-0010

The biggest lesson I have learned in life is that YOU have to be YOURSELF. And YOU have to do YOU. There is no another YOU. There never will be another YOU. 

And yet.. Did you know that being your self it is one the biggest fear of humanity? 

I am guessing it is because then not EVERYONE will like YOU, but guess what?!?! Not everyone likes you now anyway. 
Second reason that people can critique you , the problem with that that we take other people opinions about us too seriously. What does he/she knows about you to critique you? So my advice to this one - take this as other persons personal opinion. 

Feeling shame because people stopped liking you the way REALLY are? Do not worry you will meet NEW people who will LOVE YOU just the way you are.

I am out of reasons why YOU can not be YOURSELF â¤ï¸â­ï¸

Do you have more reasons?

Tag people who needs to hear this â˜ºï¸ lets share the good things!

Caption:
As we age, our #experiences #influence our thoughts and behaviors. Remember, itâ€™s never too late to change your #mindset for increased #happiness and fulfillment. This change doesnâ€™t happen overnight, but with daily intentions and consistent actions, you can start to adopt healthier ways of thinking and being.

Start by cultivating a growth mindset, viewing challenges as #opportunities for personal development. Believe in your #potential to #learn and grow, regardless of your age. Regularly practice #gratitude by acknowledging the #positives in your life, which can significantly #boost your mood and outlook.

Engage in lifelong learning to keep your mind active. Whether itâ€™s learning new skills, picking up new hobbies, or #exploring new subjects, these activities open up new avenues for joy and fulfillment.

Incorporate #mindfulness into your #daily routine. A few minutes of #meditation each day can reduce stress, increase self-awareness, and promote a sense of peace. Surround yourself with people who #uplift and #inspire you, as positive social #connections are crucial for emotional health.

Identify what truly matters to you and set achievable goals. Working towards something youâ€™re #passionate about brings a sense of purpose and satisfaction. Remember, regular #exercise benefits both your #body and #mind by reducing anxiety and depression, enhancing mood, and improving cognitive function.

Release #negativethoughts and past regrets by focusing on the #present and future. Sometimes, seeking guidance from a therapist or coach can help you reshape your mindset and overcome #mental barriers.

Reprogramming your mind is an ongoing journey. By setting daily intentions and taking consistent actions, you can unlock new levels of joy and satisfaction at any stage of life. ğŸ’™ğŸ§¿ Just remember to always out yourself first because you are worthy! âœ¨ğŸ™

Caption:
ğŸŒ **Embracing Blissful Summer Days for Mental Health and Wellness ğŸŒ**

Summer is the perfect time to prioritize your mental health and well-being. Hereâ€™s how to make the most of these sunny days:

1. **Soak Up the Sun** â˜€ï¸
 - Spend time outdoors to boost your mood and soak in that Vitamin D.
 - Go for walks, enjoy the beach, or simply relax in your backyard.

2. **Stay Active** ğŸŠâ€â™€ï¸
 - Engage in fun activities like swimming, hiking, or biking.
 - Physical activity is great for both your body and mind.

3. **Practice Mindfulness** ğŸ§˜â€â™‚ï¸
 - Take moments to meditate, do yoga, or simply breathe deeply.
 - Being present helps reduce stress and enhances well-being.

4. **Connect with Others** ğŸ¤—
 - Spend quality time with family and friends, nurturing your relationships.
 - Social connections are key to a happy and healthy life.

5. **Nourish Your Body** ğŸ¥—
 - Enjoy fresh, seasonal foods and stay hydrated.
 - Eating well fuels your body and mind for those long summer days.

6. **Unplug and Unwind** ğŸ“´
 - Take breaks from screens and immerse yourself in nature.
 - Find time to read, listen to music, or pursue a hobby you love.

7. **Cultivate Gratitude** ğŸŒ»
 - Keep a gratitude journal to remind yourself of daily blessings.
 - Embrace the joy and positivity summer brings.

Letâ€™s make this summer a season of joy, relaxation, and mental wellness! ğŸŒº

Caption:
Are you able to find the beauty in the everyday things that you see?

Sometimes, beauty can be obvious

But other times, we need to dig a bit deeper:

Ordinary Experiences
People we meet on the street
Colleagues
Those who hold a different opinion than us
Everyday relationships

You could try to shift your lens by practicing mindfulness -
Go outside and engage your five senses:

Look and observe the trees- notice their leaves, their branches, their strong roots
Or look deeply into someoneâ€™s eyes, and notice the soul behind the veneer. 

Feel the warmth of the sun on your face. Feel the cool grass underneath your feet as you walk barefoot. 
Or give a warm hug

Listen to the sound of the birds chirping. Or simply put your phone down and listen intently as your child speaks to you. 

Smell the sweetness of the honeysuckle, or deeply take in the scent of a loved one

Taste a raindrop from the sky. Or truly relish your morning cup of coffee. 

Imagine how more fulfilling relationships, experiences and all of life could be if we moved with intention and tried to find the beauty in ordinary things. 

#mindfulness #positivity #bekind #humanity #liveyourbestlife #humanconnection #relationships #connections #livewithintention #becentered #mindbodyconnection #mentalhealth #mrntalhealthmatters #livefullynow #makeitcount
Hashtags: humanity, mindfulness, positivity, mentalhealth, humanconnection, connections, bekind, makeitcount, livefullynow, mindbodyconnection, mrntalhealthmatters, becentered, livewithintention, relationships, liveyourbestlife

Caption:
### Reset Your Brain with Your Breathing ğŸ§˜â€â™€ï¸âœ¨

Did you know that your breath can change how you think and feel in seconds? ğŸŒ¬ï¸âœ¨ Controlled breathing isnâ€™t just about oxygen; itâ€™s a powerful tool for combating stress, anxiety, and sharpening your mind.

#### **The Science**
When stressed, your brain floods with noradrenaline, making it hard to focus. Deep breaths reset your brain, lowering stress and improving focus. Just breathe in for 4 counts and out for 6 â€“ itâ€™s like a magic trick for your mind! ğŸ§˜â€â™€ï¸âœ¨

#### **5 Benefits of Controlled Breathing**
1. **Reduce Stress and Anxiety** 
  Slow breathing lowers your heart rate and fight-or-flight response.

2. **Improve Memory and Decision-Making** 
  Deep breathing clears your mind and enhances problem-solving.

3. **Reduce Chronic Pain** 
  Lower stress levels to decrease pain sensitivity.

4. **Help You Sleep Better** 
  Slow breathing calms your brain for better sleep.

5. **Long-Term Health Benefits** 
  Regular practice improves heart health and reduces inflammation.

Remember: A few deep breaths can change your brain chemistry, bringing calm and control. ğŸŒ¿âœ¨ #MentalHealth #BreathingTechniques #WellnessJourney #StressRelief #Mindfulness #AnxietyRelief #HealthyLiving #sleeping #sleep #sleepaid

Caption:
As a yoga teacher, it does not matter how many people come to my class. What matters is that my students walk away feeling light and love.

As a yogi, it does not matter how long I meditate or can hold a handstand. What matters is union, my breath connecting my body with my mind.

As a woman, it does not matter how much I weigh. What matters is that I feel healthy. Health is a state of wholeness, happiness, and vibrancy in all aspects of our livesâ€”physically, mentally, emotionally, and spiritually.

Caption:
Our minds are so so powerful, sometimes I think a lot of people donâ€™t realise how powerful!

Even the simple act of starting the week on a positive note, takes the willpower and self-awareness of checking in with your feelings.

Thatâ€™s why itâ€™s so important to make meditation and mindfulness part of your regular routine, and I want to help with that.

My lunchtime meditation classes have been so lovely that this month, I am starting a second class in the week! 

From next Tuesday, 11th June at 1pm for 45 minutes we will be practising noticing what our thoughts are doing, noticing how we are feeling, what emotions we have and relaxing our body.

Caption:
Complexity denotes not complication, but rather an ever-growing awareness of how various networks and systems function together in a coherent framework.
In other words:

When we talk about complexity, we're referring to the interconnectedness and interdependence of various systems and networks. 

For example, consider the human body. It consists of multiple systems like the nervous system, circulatory system, and respiratory system. Each of these systems has its own functions and processes, but they don't operate in isolation. They work together in a coordinated manner to maintain overall health and function.

In the same way, understanding complexity involves recognizing how different components interact and influence each other. Understanding complexity allows us to appreciate how seemingly unrelated elements can come together to form a coherent and functional whole.

 It emphasizes the importance of seeing the bigger picture and recognizing the subtle and intricate connections that shape our world. By grasping these connections, we can better navigate and manage the systems we are part of, whether in health, nature, or society.

Caption:
From a spiritual perspective, the realization that reality is an illusion and the subsequent practice of mind over matter can be profound and transformative. 
ğŸ™âœ¨ğŸ’šğŸŒˆ

1**Mind Over Matter**: Once one grasps that reality is an illusion, the practice of "mind over matter" becomes significant. This concept is about harnessing the power of the mind to transcend physical limitations and alter one's perception of reality. Spiritually, it can mean achieving higher states of consciousness, manifesting desires, or healing oneself and others.

2 **Meditation and Consciousness**: Many spiritual traditions emphasize meditation as a way to realize the illusory nature of reality. Through deep meditation, individuals can experience a state of consciousness that goes beyond ordinary perception, where they feel a sense of unity with the divine or the universe. This altered state can reveal the true nature of reality and the power of the mind.

3**Practical Applications**: Spiritually, exercising mind over matter can lead to practical applications such as improved mental and physical health, increased compassion and empathy, and a greater sense of peace and purpose. Practices like visualization, positive affirmations, and energy healing (e.g., Reiki) are often used to harness the mind's power to influence physical reality.

In summary, the spiritual journey from recognizing the illusory nature of reality to practicing mind over matter involves a deep transformation of consciousness. It encourages individuals to look beyond the surface of their experiences, tapping into a deeper understanding of the self and the universe, ultimately leading to greater spiritual awareness and enlightenment.
 #reikimaster  #reiki  #spiritualgrowth  #love  #innerpeace  #ascensionjourney  #mindfulness  #newbeginnings2024

Caption:
Why Should I Meditate?

Stress. Thatâ€™s why.

The latest statistics indicate 74% of adults in the UK are stressed, and is it any wonder after the last few years?  The impact of this statistic means that both our mental and physical health is being adversely affected.

The effects of long-term stress put our overall health at risk. 

To cope, some people turn to food to self-medicate, gaining weight, leading to a new set of health problems. 60% of UK adults medicate through alcohol.  And whilst a social gin is perfectly acceptable, there can be a time with alcohol when the fun stops. 

Stress can also bring with it a whole array of mental health problems including anxiety and depression. 

As a nation, we are getting sicker. Managing your stress levels is crucial for improving your overall wellbeing.

Lowering stress levels will enhance your focus on tasks, improving productivity whether at work or home. 

Your emotional health improves with lower stress, fostering a positive outlook and emotional stability.

It can also improve your sleep hygiene; a better nightâ€™s sleep means everything feels better.  You will have more energy to tackle the day. 

It will also lower blood pressure levels and boost your immune system.

I work with busy people who are looking for ways to boost resilience and manage their stress so that they donâ€™t always feel as if they are on the back foot with life.

Using a range of techniques, I work with you to develop a self-care routine that fits in with your lifestyle to lower stress levels without the woo. 

Want to know more? 

Drop me a message and letâ€™s chat.

ğŸŒŸ Today, let's discuss fasting as a spiritual practice. ğŸŒŸâ 
â 
Long fasting refers to fasting periods beyond 24 hours, often 48-hour or even 72-hour fasts. While typically seen for its physical benefits, fasting also offers significant emotional and psychological advantages.â 
â 
ğŸŒ¿ Mental Clarity and Focus: Many report enhanced mental clarity and focus during fasting due to stable energy from increased ketone production.â 
â 
ğŸŒ¿ Increased Resilience: Fasting helps develop emotional resilience. Overcoming hunger teaches coping with discomfort in other life areas, improving stress management and challenge-facing abilities.â 
â 
ğŸŒ¿ Mood Improvement: Fasting boosts mood by stimulating serotonin production, which regulates mood, happiness, and anxiety. It also increases brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF), crucial for mental health.â 
â 
ğŸŒ¿ Sense of Achievement and Control: Completing fasting periods provides a sense of achievement and empowerment, boosting self-esteem and confidence in managing eating habits and health.â 
â 
ğŸŒ¿ Spiritual and Emotional Reflection: Integrated in many spiritual practices, fasting allows for introspection and meditation, leading to a deeper connection with thoughts and emotions, fostering peace and purpose.â 
â 
ğŸŒ¿ Reduction in Anxiety: Fasting regulates hormonal balance, reduces anxiety, and stabilizes energy levels, helping manage nervousness linked to blood sugar fluctuations.â 
â 
ğŸŒ¿ Detoxification and Emotional Cleansing: Physical detoxification during fasting often leads to a sense of emotional cleansing, resulting in improved emotional well-being.â 
â 
When done correctly and safely, fasting can enhance both physical and emotional wellness. Approach fasting mindfully and ideally under the guidance of a healthcare professional to ensure safety and effectiveness.â 
â

Caption:
Yes, de workshop 'Gewaarzijn' staat! Ik geef deze samen met Fred Korthagen van Korthagen Opleidingen. 

De workshop Gewaarzijn is nuttig voor wie wil leven en werken vanuit een ruimer perspectief. Een zienswijze waarbij je in contact komt met meer opties om met jezelf, anderen en je omgeving om te gaan. De workshop geeft je de mogelijkheid om jouw waarneming te verfijnen. Je krijgt er als het ware een intelligent en sensitief zintuig bij. Je bent daardoor beter in staat om dat wat voorheen onzichtbaar leek, nu eenvoudiger â€˜boven het tapijtâ€™ te krijgen. Het helpt je ook om innerlijk meer verbonden te zijn met jezelf, waardoor je steviger in je eigen kern verankerd bent. De workshop ondersteunt je om te werken vanuit jouw diepste kwaliteiten en om meer wijsheid in te brengen in jouw relaties.

Ben je nieuwsgierig, lees verder op mijn website.

Caption:
I get cues from nature all the time. Recently, I unconsciously took time for myself (more on this in future posts). I would liken it to a bit of hibernation. Bears hibernate as a means of protection and survival during food scarce winters. Their behavior teaches us that there are times for deep stillness. It isnâ€™t a luxury. It is a necessity. It is required for us to survive
 
Sadly, the hyperfocus to perform above all costs and to abandon ourselves to a world that canâ€™t support our inner needs results in exhaustion and disconnect from what is truly important. It doesnâ€™t need to be this way. Do you agree?
 
By the time you realize you are exhausted, trust youâ€™ve been overloading yourself for a while. Replenish your energy. Nurture the senses. Take a break within.
 
#retreat #comingoutofhibernation #mindfulness #spirituality #consciousleadership #womeninleadership #leadershipdevelopment
Hashtags: retreat, consciousleadership, womeninleadership, leadershipdevelopment, comingoutofhibernation, spirituality, mindfulness

Caption:
Self-soothing is the ability to calm oneself during moments of stress or anxiety without external assistance. Techniques include deep breathing, mindfulness, and engaging in comforting activities such as reading or listening to music. Developing self-soothing skills can improve emotional regulation and resilience. It allows individuals to manage their emotions more effectively and maintain a sense of inner peace. Practicing self-soothing regularly can lead to better mental health and overall well-being .FOLLOW FOR MORE @self.caresecret #SelfSoothing

Caption:
ğŸ§  Myth vs. Fact: Understanding Mental Health ğŸ§ 

As we continue to observe Mental Health Awareness Month, itâ€™s important to challenge the misconceptions that surround mental health issues. Letâ€™s break down some common myths and share the facts to help everyone get a clearer, more accurate understanding.

ğŸš« Myth: Mental health problems are rare. âœ… Fact: Mental health conditions are more common than you think. About 1 in 5 adults experience a mental health illness each year.
ğŸš« Myth: Children donâ€™t experience mental health problems. âœ… Fact: Even young children may show early warning signs of mental health concerns. These are often clinically diagnosable, and can be a product of the interaction of biological, psychological, and social factors.

ğŸš« Myth: People with mental health issues are violent and unpredictable. âœ… Fact: The majority of people with mental health problems are no more likely to be violent than anyone else. In fact, they are more likely to be victims of violent crime.

ğŸš« Myth: Mental health problems donâ€™t affect me. âœ… Fact: Mental health issues can affect anyone regardless of age, gender, geography, income, social status, race/ethnicity, religion/spirituality, sexual orientation, background, or other aspects of cultural identity.

ğŸš« Myth: People with mental health needs, even those who are managing their mental illness, cannot tolerate the stress of holding down a job. âœ… Fact: People with mental health problems are just as productive as other employees. Employers who hire people with mental health problems report good attendance and punctuality as well as motivation, good work, and job tenure on par with or greater than other employees.

Letâ€™s continue to educate ourselves and others! Share this post to spread awareness and help end the stigma around mental health. ğŸ’ªğŸ’š

In today's world, we are constantly surrounded by noise â€“ whether it's the bustling city streets, office hustle, or even home gadgets.

Caption:
Did you know trauma can show up in your body? 

Most of my coaching clients didnâ€™t know that trauma can show up in their body in multiple ways. 

Trauma has a profound impact on physical health. It can cause muscle tension, fatigue, long-term health issues, an increased fight-flight-freeze response, and changes in brain function and structure. It is crucial to address trauma to improve overall health and well-being.

How has trauma showing up for you these days? 

Want to address these issues? â¡ï¸ Tap the link in the bio to schedule a consultation.

Caption:
There is no true spiritual evolution without the Divine Mother. It is through her that we are able to come to a place of stillness and acknowledgement of being. It is through the Divine Mother that we are able to discover and nurture the truth of who we are through physical, embodied experience. Through the experience, we uncover more of who we are as Divine beings, learning and unveiling what may be standing in the way of truly understanding this as the reality. We can take in information, we can accumulate it....it is entertaining. But how are we living? What choices are being made on a regular basis? What are we choosing to embody and express in the world? One of the many gifts of the Divine Mother is that of choice. So it is by allowing her grace to move through us that we are able to see the choice in daily life. And it is by choosing to live in accordance with love that the truth is unveiled to us. 

Much love, 

Saiedah ğŸŒ¹

Caption:
Celebrating Cancer Survivor Month! ğŸŒŸ
As we kick off Cancer Survivor Month, I am filled with gratitude and hope. 

This month is a tribute to the strength, resilience, and unwavering spirit of every cancer survivor and thriver out there.

At Healing Whispur, my mission is to support and empower those affected by cancer through mindfulness and mindset coaching. 

I believe that every journey is unique and that healing begins in the mind.

Today, let's celebrate our victories, no matter how small. 

Let's honor our journeys and the courage it takes to face each day with hope and determination.

Whether you are a survivor, a thriver, or supporting someone on their journey, you are not alone. 

Together, we can create a community of healing and strength. 

Join me as we continue to inspire, uplift, and empower one another.

SHARE your story or a message of support in the comments belowâ¤µï¸. 

Letâ€™s build a community where every survivor's voice is heard, and every journey is celebrated. ğŸŒŸ

Caption:
In a surreal world where the boundaries of reality and fantasy blurred into a vivid tapestry of crazy, there lived an enigmatic figure known as the "Madness Merchant." This eccentric character was a master of the bizarre and a connoisseur of the unconventional. No one could quite explain who he was or where he came from, for he seemed to drift in and out of the collective imagination of the curious and the creative.

The Madness Merchant's peculiar existence was dedicated to one singular purpose: to unearth and barter in the most unconventional and twisted ideas that the human mind could conceive. He roamed the fringes of the known world, gathering fragments of insanity, oddities, and whimsical notions. He traded in these peculiar commodities with a motley crew of artists, writers, and free thinkers.

One day, he encountered a young baker named Alice who was down on her luck. She had a small pastry shop on the corner of a sleepy street, but her cakes and cookies, while delicious, didn't quite bring in the crowds. Her dreams of becoming a renowned pastry chef were fading.

The Madness Merchant sensed an opportunity in the air. He proposed an exchange: her baking skills in return for an unusual ingredient. It was called the "Madness Matrix," a mystical substance that, when mixed into her recipes, would transform her ordinary baked goods into mad confections of wonder and enchantment.

As her shop gained notoriety, more and more patrons flocked to experience her eccentric culinary creations. The smell of her baking wafted through the air, and it was said that just one bite would unleash your wildest dreams or your deepest fears.

In this unlikely partnership of the Madness Merchant and the "Baking Bad Matrix," Alice's confections had truly become mad. The town, once known for its peaceful monotony, had become a haven for the odd, the curious, and those willing to embrace the insanity in every bite.

Caption:
ğŸ¸Storia della Rana di Chomsky

Immagina una rana che, avvicinandosi a una pentola di acqua bollente, salta subito via per evitare il pericolo evidente. Ma se la stessa rana viene messa in una pentola di acqua fredda, che viene lentamente riscaldata, non percepisce il pericolo crescente e alla fine rimane nella pentola fino a essere bollita viva.

Questa metafora, nota come â€œla rana di Noam Chomskyâ€, illustra come spesso nella vita non riusciamo a percepire i pericoli quando si avvicinano gradualmente. Invece di reagire a piccoli segnali di allarme, ci adattiamo lentamente a situazioni sempre piÃ¹ negative, come un lavoro stressante o relazioni opprimenti. La lezione Ã¨ chiara: dobbiamo essere consapevoli dei cambiamenti sottili e reagire tempestivamente prima che le circostanze diventino insostenibili. 

Quindi, quando ti accorgi che una situazione sta peggiorando poco a poco, pensa alla rana di Chomsky e considera se Ã¨ il momento di saltare via prima che sia troppo tardi. La consapevolezza e lâ€™azione proattiva sono essenziali per evitare di ritrovarsi in situazioni insostenibili.

Caption:
5 days VIP with Steinar is doneğŸ’•âœ¨!

Its been fantastic days with a really nice group of people!

Thank you everybody for coming and making it so nice!

Its incredible what happens in short time and several people saying they feel they have a new horse (and feel like new themself). Im very honored to be a part of and see the beautiful transformations!

The last day many wanted to be in our beautiful forrest again, some focus on body awareness, bodywork and riding. And also how we put it all together as one coctail.Â 

Steinar and me bicycled with the riding participants, and Steinar did even bicycle with a poolnoodle, not sure what my neighbors think :). But we had a great time!Â 

In the breaks Steinar as per usual did his crazy yoga stretches ;).

And dont forget that Steinar comes in July and Sep if you want to have the great oppertuny to be a part of it!

Caption:
Introducing BECOMINGâ€¦.. A New Chapter. A New Mission

âœ¨âœ¨âœ¨

I have been excitedly working on something new behind the scenes for a long time but I didnâ€™t have complete clarity on the vision and mission until it came to me in my breathwork BUT for once NOT me on the mat!!

When teaching my classes I kept getting downloads for meditations and visualisations that were empowering and exciting, taking participants into a future version of themselves. 

I kept hearing myself sayâ€¦ who are you â€œbecomingâ€ and â€œstep into that version of youâ€ 

I was getting excited for every single person who was breathing with me at every class and I took.

I heard the call and I listened âœ¨

Becoming is a journey of letting go of who you think you are, your patterns, habits and stories of your past that are holding you back. 

Becoming is empowering you to unapologetically have it all and bravely step into a version of you who already exists in the future. 

Becoming has 4 phases of transformationâ€¦

REALISING who you think you and becoming aware. 

OVERCOMING who you think you are a recreating who you want to be. 

BELIEVING that who you want to become is a possibility that exists and you are worthy. 

And BECOMING, the empowerment of embodying your journey and falling love with your new life 

BECOMING embodies coaching, healing, sound, breathwork with powerful practices such as visualisation, manifestation, quantum jumping and d ritual to create powerful and impactful change 

Becoming is my journey 

Becoming is your journey

You can breathe with me in person (Sevenoaks / Tunbridge Wells / London) or new monthly online classes 

Or

You can join my Becoming The Future You Manifestation Masterclass in Sevenoaks 26.6 

Or 

You can apply to join my Becoming Transformation 16 week program for women who are newly single after a long term relationship or divorce. 

Links for ALL in my bio â™¥ï¸

I canâ€™t wait to share more of this with you. I am literally bursting with excitement!!!

Are you as excited as me? â¬‡ï¸

Caption:
Foundations in Teaching Mindfulness Meditation - starts 3rd July @michaelstoneteaching 

â€œOur lives happen in the present moment. Often we are preoccupied and distracted, and we donâ€™t have the skills for inhabiting the body in a way thatâ€™s safe, still, and calm.â€ Michael Stone

The 9 week course developed and delivered by the late Michael Stone, will provide insights into the art and science of mindfulness. It is designed both for people interested in maturing and developing a personal practice and as a foundation to offering mindfulness-based interventions to others in a class-based setting.

The course is linear and structured in its approach, allowing students to explore their own personal journey on a week by week basis, with guided videos from Michael, readings and audio practices to help build a base of both knowledge and experience. Students will have one week to complete the requirements for each module before being able to move on to the next module as a way to ensure that the whole group begins and ends the training at the same time.

"This has been a very enlightening and enjoyable experience. I found the Mindfulness Practice Teaching exercises confidence building for my teaching, and I loved the range of techniques and detail of the audios and video excerpts. The content progressed in a digestible and logical way as we moved though the course. I particularly enjoyed the chance to reflect and submit to the group discussion points and share experiences with each other on the course. I leave with a deeper understanding of meditation and how to offer these valuable practices to others".

Olivia Marquis, Remembering Michael Stone: Foundations in Teaching Mindfulness Meditation Training

#michaelstone #mindfulness #meditation
Hashtags: meditation, michaelstone, mindfulness

Caption:
In this collection (as well as a lot of my previous work), I deface the painting as a way to make fun of the seriousness of the portrait. It's my sarcastic sense of humour trying to make sense â€“ to laugh because otherwise we might cry â€“ about the absurdity of life and the experiences so many of us face.

Every person who has sat for me has a story to tell. A story often with a lot of love and joy, juxtaposed with heartache, or health worries or financial problems: their perceived failures.

From infertility to mental health challenges, so many of these are shared by us all. The more I work and meet women the more I see the invisible thread that connects us all. We are so bound together and have so much that unites us beyond our age, career or marital status. And I'm just trying to tell part of that story. 

#united #womensupportingwomen #vulnerability #vulnerabilityisstrength #funnyart #tellmeyourstory #mindfulness #meditation #abstractportrait #contemporaryart #artcollector #emergingartist #norwichartist #norwichartist

Caption:
Celebrating Cancer Survivor Month! ğŸŒŸ
As we kick off Cancer Survivor Month, I am filled with gratitude and hope. This month is a tribute to the strength, resilience, and unwavering spirit of every cancer survivor and thriver out there.
At Healing Whispur, my mission is to support and empower those affected by cancer through mindfulness and mindset coaching. I believe that every journey is unique and that healing begins in the mind.
Today, let's celebrate our victories, no matter how small. Let's honor our journeys and the courage it takes to face each day with hope and determination.
Whether you are a survivor, a thriver, or supporting someone on their journey, you are not alone. Together, we can create a community of healing and strength. Join me as we continue to inspire, uplift, and empower one another.

SHARE your story or a message of support in the comments belowâ¤µï¸. Letâ€™s build a community where every survivor's voice is heard, and every journey is celebrated. ğŸŒŸ

ğŸŒŸ **Embark on a Year of Growth with "A Handbook for New Stoics" by Massimo Pigliucci and Gregory Lopez** ğŸ“˜

ğŸ§˜â€â™‚ï¸ Transform your life week by week with this practical guide to Stoicism. "A Handbook for New Stoics" offers 52 lessons that teach you how to gain peace and resilience in a world that's beyond your control.

ğŸ“š **What You'll Learn:**
- **Practical Exercises**: Each week, engage with exercises that teach you how to apply Stoic principles to modern life.
- **Emotional Resilience**: Discover how to maintain tranquility in the face of adversity and control what you can while accepting what you cannot.

â³ **Duration**: 10 hours and 44 minutes of insightful, life-changing strategies.

ğŸ” **Why This Book?**
- **Accessible Stoicism**: Whether you're a philosophy newbie or a seasoned thinker, this book breaks down complex ideas into actionable steps.
- **Enhanced Well-being**: Learn to detach from external pressures and focus on internal growth for a happier, more fulfilled life.

ğŸ“˜ Dive into "A Handbook for New Stoics" and start your journey towards a more resilient and peaceful self. It's not just about reading; it's about transforming through practice.

Symptoms of ADHD that cause trouble to your relationship:â 
â€¢ Forgetfulnessâ 
â€¢ Trouble paying attentionâ 
â€¢ Emotional Outburstsâ 
â€¢ Impulsivity â 
â 
How to help your partner and yourself manage symptoms?â 
â€¢ Look at things from your partnerâ€™s perspective â 
â€¢ Educate yourselves on ADHDâ

â€¢ Work together as a teamâ

Caption:
Dear Dharma Friends,
Thank you for your continued support and understanding of the dissemination effort of Soto Zen School.
This is 3rd time post regarding Noto peninsula in Ishikawa relief fund.
We extend our prays for the victims and their families and wish for their early recovery and restoration of life.
We appreciate it if you could kindly send checks to the Association of Soto Zen Buddhists so that we can transfer the amount to the Soto shu shumu-cho, Soto Zen Buddhism administrative headquarters office in Japan.
More than 100 Soto Zen temples affected by the disaster. We are sharing the photos of some temples.
We would appreciate it if you could help us raise relief funds with the support from your sangha and community members.
You can see more damages from this website. https://www.sotozen-net.jp/report/

ãƒ»Payment deadline: June 30th, 2024
ãƒ»Payment Method  1. Mailing cash or a checkã€€2. PayPal mailto:info@sotozen.us
 *Check (payable to Association of Soto Zen Buddhists)
 Mailing Address: 123 South Hewitt St, Los Angeles, CA 90012

In Gassho,

Rev. Gengo Akiba, Director
Association of Soto Zen Buddhists a.k.a. Soto Zen Buddhism North America Office

Caption:
"slow" das nehme ich mir aus unserem Wochenende auf Gozo mit in den Alltag.

Auf Malta und Gozo gilt Linksverkehr, die Strassen sind abenteuerlich. Dieser "slow"- Schriftzug taucht alle paar Meter auf der Strasse auf, um daran zu erinnern, daÃŸ zu hohe Geschwindigkeiten gefÃ¤hrlich sein kÃ¶nnen.

Ist das im Leben nicht auch so? Besonders wenn du zu den Menschen gehÃ¶rst, die dazu neigen durchs Leben zu rennen um so viel wie mÃ¶glich zu erleben. Oder auf der Arbeit noch ein wenig mehr machen, damit die Projekte erfolgreich und perfekt werden.

Schnell und immer on time oder in bester Performance zu sein, ist anstrengend. Dieses Tempo ist anstrengend. 

Entschleunigung, Zeit fÃ¼r die wirklich wichtigen Dinge, Zeit zum Nichtstun, Zeit in den Tag hinein zu leben, zu tanzen und das zu tun worauf wir Lust haben - einfach so! Das Leben mal wieder mit allen Sinnen bewusst wahrnehmen und die Lebensfreude & Leichtigkeit zurÃ¼ck holen.

Davon werde ich mir nun tÃ¤glich etwas schenken - "Slow" darf mich liebevoll an dieses Versprechen erinnern.

Wie ist das bei dir? Brauchst du Entschleunigung oder hast du schon einen Weg gefunden es "langsamer" angehen zu lassen?
Oder gehÃ¶rst du zu den glÃ¼cklichen Menschen, die bereits ausgeglichen und entschleunigt leben? Was ist dein Geheimnis?

.

.
